page.title: 13RECREATION IN PUTTENHAM
page.content:
There is an eighteen hole{golf course on Puttenham Heath. The club was founded in 1894 and has grown steadily. A new club house was built in 1984.
Just below Frosbury hill, where Queen Victoria stood in 1858 to review her troops, and also on the heath, there is a{cricket club.
The{bowls club }have a green nearby and are sometimes in danger from golfers who slice their drives off the first tee.
The{Puttenham football club}run two teams which play on the Recreation ground in the village, and in 1985 they are raising money to build a new pavilion.
